title: MetaMask's Secret Project Could Shake Up How Ethereum Works - CoinDesk
summary: MetaMask is working on a secret project that could revolutionize how Ethereum works. The project is focused on creating a safe, feature-rich, and high-performing system that will give users more control over their Ethereum transactions. Once completed, the project will be made available to the industry, allowing users to adopt it and use it in the way they see fit.

title: Dencun upgrade goes live on Ethereum's Goerli testnet - crypto.news
summary: The Dencun upgrade, a major update to Ethereum's Goerli testnet, has gone live despite low participation among validators. The upgrade, which includes "proto-danksharding" to reduce layer-2 transaction fees, resulted in a chain split and is currently being investigated by client teams. The next phase of the upgrade will take place on the Sepolia and Holesky testnets in January and February, followed by a rollout on the Ethereum mainnet by the end of Q1 2024. The Dencun upgrade aims to increase blockchain space for data blobs and slash layer-2 rollup fees, scaling Ethereum's blockchain without hiking gas fees.

title: Ethereum's Dencun Upgrade Goes Live, But Fails to Finalize on Testnet - Yahoo Finance
summary: Ethereum's Dencun upgrade, which went live on the Goerli testnet, failed to finalize as expected. The issue was due to a bug in Prysm nodes, but was later patched. The upgrade is part of a three-phase approach to improve the main Ethereum blockchain's data storage capacity and reduce transaction costs. The next phase will occur in the next few weeks on the Sepolia and Holesky testnets. This is the biggest upgrade for Ethereum since the Shapella upgrade last March, which enabled staked ether withdrawals.

title: Ethereum Dencun Testnet Upgrade Fails to Finalize As Expected - Milk Road
summary: Ethereum's Dencun testnet upgrade failed to finalize as expected on the Goerli test network. The upgrade, which aims to boost network capacity, was initiated but did not complete transactions as planned. The failure is attributed to a lack of nodes upgrading the necessary components to facilitate consensus. This setback highlights potential validation and software shortcomings ahead of deploying major network changes. Developers are now working to diagnose and resolve the issues before initiating further trials. The next test phases will involve the Sepolia and Kintsugi testnets. The Dencun upgrade is a significant change for Ethereum since last year's Merge and rigorous testing is crucial to minimize mainnet disruptions.

title: What Is Immutable? The Ethereum Network for Crypto and NFT Games - Decrypt
summary: Immutable X is a layer-2 scaling network built on top of Ethereum, designed for crypto and NFT games. It provides fast and low-cost transactions, using StarkWare's ZK rollup technology, and supports all Ethereum wallets. Immutable X is expanding with another new zkEVM scaling network, in partnership with Polygon. The platform has attracted numerous NFT marketplaces and game developers, including Rarible, Mintable, and GameStop. As of January 2024, the IMX token is the most valuable gaming token, with a market cap of nearly $2.7 billion.

title: Vitalik Buterin Makes Important Statement About Ethereum Layer 2s - U.Today
summary: Vitalik Buterin recently discussed the importance of understanding the different types of L2 (layer 2) solutions for the Ethereum network. He highlighted the distinction between "security-favoring" solutions like rollups and "scale-favoring" solutions like validiums. Rollups offer higher security but are more expensive, while validiums provide cheaper scalability with a slight security tradeoff. Buterin proposed using terms like "strong L2" for rollups and "light L2" for validiums to help users navigate their choices better. He also acknowledged that the architecture of L2 solutions is not solely about security levels, with a complex intermediate space between rollups and validiums.

The percentage of Ether's circulating supply in profit has also risen to a multi-year high of 91.8%.

title: Laser-Eyed Franklin Templeton Sets Sights on Ethereum, Solana After Bitcoin - Decrypt
summary: Franklin Templeton, a global investment firm, has expressed interest in Ethereum and Solana after approving its spot Bitcoin ETFs. title: Frax Finance's Layer 2 Fraxtal to Debut in February: Founder - CoinDesk
summary: Frax Finance's Layer 2 solution, Fraxtal, will debut in February with a unique blockspace incentives feature called Flox. Users and developers can earn a constant yield through an incentive program and weekly point gauge system by paying for blockspace on the chain.

title: Ripple CTO Addresses Concerns Behind XRP Ledger Missing Genesis Block, Cites Ethereum Example - The Crypto Basic
summary: Ripple CTO David Schwartz addressed concerns about the missing genesis block on the XRP Ledger (XRPL), comparing it to the similar case of Ethereum. Schwartz explained that the choice of what to consider the genesis block is arbitrary and that Ethereum has transactions predating its official start that are not publicly documented. He also pointed out that Ethereum's genesis block has 40,000 ETH tokens that are not publicly visible, just like the missing genesis block on the XRPL. Schwartz emphasized that the source of these tokens is not publicly visible due to deliberate decisions in defining the genesis block. He confirmed that the XRPL genesis block had no transactions, but there were 534 transactions in the first 32,570 ledgers, which are now lost. Schwartz has consistently debunked concerns about the distribution scheme of XRP and reassured users that the missing ledgers hold no significance for average XRPL users.

title: Ethereum’s Dencun Upgrade is Live on Goerli Testnet, But There is a Catch - CryptoPotato
summary: Ethereum's highly anticipated Dencun upgrade has gone live on the Goerli testnet, but there are issues with finality. The upgrade, which aims to reduce transaction costs on layer 2 (L2) networks, failed to reach consensus and finality, with only 80% of validators participating. Developers believe this may be due to validators being offline, and they will conduct a non-finality test over the next few days to evaluate the status. Despite the setback, the upgrade is expected to significantly enhance Ethereum L2 rollup efficiency and slash transaction costs by 10x or more.

title: Ethereum Developers Deploy Testnet for Dencun Upgrade - Coinspeaker
summary:

However, the testnet faced challenges, including low participation rates and a chain split. Developers are working to resolve the issues and plan to deploy Dencun on additional testnets in January and February. The upgrade is expected to go live by the end of the first quarter of the year, bringing proto-danksharding to increase Ethereum's capacity for data handling and make it cheaper to use.

title: Crypto Developers Dropped 24% in 2023 as Builders Look Beyond Bitcoin, Ethereum - Decrypt
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Crypto developers have dropped by 24% in the last year, according to a new report from Electric Capital. However, the majority of these developers were fair-weather builders who had little prior experience in the industry. Developers with one to two years of experience only saw a marginal decline, while those with over two years of experience grew by 33%. The geographic diversity of developers has also increased, with non-Western countries accounting for a larger share. Ethereum remains the most popular blockchain for developers, but other networks such as Polygon, Solana, and Base are seeing an uptick in activity. Bitcoin's developer ecosystem has shrunk, with less than 10% of developers working on Ordinals, but these digital assets account for a significant portion of transaction traffic on the network.

title: Ethereum Moves One Step Closer Toward Major Scalability Upgrade - Decrypt
summary: Ethereum has taken a step closer to improving its scalability with the launch of the Dencun upgrade on a testnet. The upgrade, which includes the proto-danksharding feature, aims to increase the network's capacity to handle over 100,000 transactions per second. This is a significant improvement for Ethereum, which has long struggled with scalability issues. The upgrade is expected to be fully live on the mainnet soon, and will require validators to upgrade to the newest software in order to participate.

title: Ethereum Dencun Q1 Release at Risk? Ethereum Dencun Upgrade Hits Snags in First Testnet Outing - DailyCoin
summary: Ethereum's Dencun upgrade, which aims to improve the network's scalability, has faced delays after encountering issues during its first testnet outing on Goerli. Despite months of preparation, the upgrade failed to achieve finality, and low network participation was cited as a reason. Developers are now investigating the causes and testing the upgrade on two more testnets before launching it on the mainnet. The delay may affect the previously announced Q1 launch date, and the full danksharding vision, which aims to address Ethereum's scalability concerns, is still years away.

title: Developer Hails ETH Burning, Will Ethereum Break $3,000? - NewsBTC
summary: Developer Péter Szilágyi praises EIP-1559, which has leveled the playing field between validators and regular users by introducing a base fee that is burned or sent to an irretrievable wallet. Since its implementation, over 3.9 million ETH have been destroyed, and the network has automatically sent over 21,100 ETH out of circulation in the last week alone. This has made Ethereum deflationary, with the potential to increase prices in the long term. However, prices are currently bullish in the short to medium term, with upsides capped at around $3,000.

title: Ripple CTO Exposes XRP and Ethereum (ETH) Genesis Block Secrets - U.Today
summary: Ripple CTO David Schwartz revealed that the genesis block of Ethereum (ETH) has undisclosed transactions that determine the allocation of funds, similar to XRPL. In XRPL, 534 transactions are missing in the first 32,570 ledgers, with specific ownership percentages known for individuals and entities like Jed McCaleb, Chris Larssen, and OpenCoin. The revelation raises questions about transparency and decision-making processes in blockchain ecosystems.
